title: Phumelele Bhengu
text:
Phumelele Ace Bhengu (born 19 November 1989) is a South African <a href="Association%20football">football</a>er who plays as a <a href="Midfielder%23Winger">winger</a> or <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">centre forward</a> for <a href="Tshakhuma%20Tsha%20Madzivhandila%20F.C.">Tshakhuma Madzivhandila</a>.
Club career.
Moroka Swallows.
5 years after joining <a href="Moroka%20Swallows%20F.C.">Moroka Swallows'</a> youth academy at the age of 14, in 2008 Bhengu started playing senior football in the <a href="Premier%20Soccer%20League">Premier Soccer League</a>. After scoring a brace against <a href="Kaizer%20Chiefs%20F.C.">Kaizer Chiefs</a> Bhengu was praised and compared to <a href="Benni%20McCarthy">Benni McCarthy</a>.
Bay United.
In January 2011, Bhengu joined <a href="Bay%20United%20F.C.">Bay United</a> on a 6-month loan deal. At Bay United, Bhengu reverted to playing as a striker.
Chippa United.
In January 2013, Bhengu joined <a href="Chippa%20United%20F.C.">Chippa United</a> on a two-and-a-half-year deal, but was released two weeks later with Chippa United citing a lack of match fitness as the reason.
Thanda Royal Zulu.
In the second half of 2013, Bhengu joined <a href="Thanda%20Royal%20Zulu%20F.C.">Thanda Royal Zulu</a> and started reviving his career.
Bhengu finished the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20National%20First%20Division">2014–15 season</a> as the top-scorer, scoring 22 goals and setting a new <a href="National%20First%20Division">National First Division</a> record.
SuperSport United.
After winning the <a href="National%20First%20Division">National First Division</a>'s golden boot award, Bhengu turned down offers from <a href="Kaizer%20Chiefs%20F.C.">Kaizer Chiefs</a> and <a href="Mamelodi%20Sundowns%20F.C.">Mamelodi Sundowns</a> to join <a href="SuperSport%20United%20F.C.">SuperSport United</a>.
Bhengu's first season with SuperSport United was not successful, managing only four substitute appearances, prompting him to request a loan move to gain game-time.
